Congratulations to John Small students Lydia Smith, Mackenzie Conaway and Alizon Tellez Resendiz.

These students won a Lowe’s Toolbox for Education grant in the amount of $2,500! Through a research project for Lego Robotics, they recently learned about the psychological effects of plants on the brain.

On May 10th, they got word that their project, "Plant Positive" was funded and they will be able to provide plants in every classroom! Each classroom will now have a plant to help calm nerves, improve memory, increase brain performance and boost moods! This idea and grant work was totally theirs and they should be extremely proud!

She makes learning FUN, and it’s contagious!”

We are honored and pleased to have Mrs. Soistman teaching in Beaufort County Schools.

Thank you,

Beaufort County schools will operate on a three hour delay tomorrow, January 19th, for students and staff.

With the help of the daytime temperatures today and the hard work of NC DOT and others, many of our roads have been cleared; however, there continue to be icy spots in some shaded areas and on parts of roads that are not heavily traveled and we know these will refreeze tonight making travel difficult in the morning in some areas.

Please be careful as you drive as many of the spots are in curves and shaded areas and difficult to see until you are on them. If you have a special circumstance regarding weather and attendance tomorrow, please contact your school’s principal.

Thank you have a great evening

BCS will be closed Tuesday, January 9th for students and it will be an optional workday for staff, with staff reporting at 10:00 am.

The BCS sponsored New Bus Driver Training will take place as scheduled.

We have spent a lot of time today checking roads across the county, while some are very clear and dry there are places on many back roads and side roads that remain covered in snow and ice. We are not comfortable with buses traveling until the conditions improve. We also want to stress that staff should NOT attempt to come to work unless it is safe to do so. Principals and supervisors will work with staff, so please do not travel unless safe to do so. The road conditions vary widely across the county, so please be aware of road conditions from your stating point to your destination before you attempt to drive.
